intro: Cerasus borealis, commonly known as the northern cherry or boreal cherry, is a species of flowering plant in the Prunus genus. It is native to the cold climates of northern North America and parts of Eurasia. This deciduous shrub or small tree typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a serrated margin, while its flowers are white or pale pink. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are adapted to thrive in harsh, alpine or boreal environments.
